short-title.#text:
Natural Disaster Fairness in
			 Contracting Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the
In this Act:

section 4 of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act/s:4

term.#tail:
means reconstruction efforts undertaken in an
			 area subject to a declaration by the President of a major disaster under

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 401 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:401

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the head of an executive agency, in entering into a
			 contract to procure property or services in connection with natural disaster
			 reconstruction efforts, shall comply with the requirements under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b

text.#text:
Except as provided
			 under

section 303 of

Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
The exceptions to the requirement for
			 competitive procedures provided under

header.#text:
Written approval
			 for use of noncompetitive procedures required for certain contracts

text.#text:
The head of an executive agency may enter into a
			 contract to procure property or services in connection with natural disaster
			 reconstruction efforts using other than full and open competition only upon the
			 written approval of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 the head of the executive agency negotiating such contract shall notify the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:4/ss:a

text.#text:
If procedures other than full and open competitive
			 procedures are to be used to enter into a contract described in

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Appropriations of the
			 Senate

committee-name.#tail:
, and the
			 standing committees of the Senate and the House of Representatives that have
			 jurisdiction over the executive agency not later than 7 calendar days before
			 the award of the contract.
committee-name.#text:
Committee on
			 Appropriations of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
The
			 notification under

the justification
			 for the use of other than full and open competitive procedures;

a brief
			 description of the contract’s scope;

the amount of the
			 contract;

a list of the
			 contractors solicited; and

the justification
			 and approval documents, required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, upon
			 which the determination of use of procedures other than full and open
			 competitive procedures was based.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 303(f)(1) of the Federal
			 Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949/s:303/ss:f/p:1

text.#text:
This section shall not apply to contracts of less than
			 $5,000,000.

This
			 section shall apply to any extension, amendment, or modification of a contract
			 for the procurement of property or services in connection with natural disaster
			 reconstruction efforts entered into before the date of the enactment of this
			 Act using other than full and open competitive procedures.

This section shall not apply to contracts authorized
			 under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Small Business Act
usc/15/631/etseq

text.#text:
The head of an executive agency that enters into a
			 contract for the procurement of property or services in connection with natural
			 disaster reconstruction efforts through the use of other than full and open
			 competitive procedures shall publish in the Federal Register or Federal
			 Business Opportunities, and otherwise make available to the public not later
			 than 7 calendar days before the date on which the contract is finalized—

the amount of the
			 contract;

a brief
			 description of the scope of the contract;

an explanation of
			 how the executive agency identified, and solicited offers from, potential
			 contractors to perform the contract, and a list of the potential contractors
			 that were issued solicitations for the offers; and

the justification
			 and approval documents, required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, on
			 which was based the determination to use procedures other than competitive
			 procedures.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 303(f)(1) of the Federal
			 Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949/s:303/ss:f/p:1

text.#text:
This section shall not apply to contracts of less than
			 $5,000,000.

This
			 section shall apply to any extension, amendment, or modification of a contract
			 entered into before the date of the enactment of this Act using other than full
			 and open competitive procedures.

This section shall not apply to contracts authorized
			 under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Small Business Act
usc/15/631/etseq

text.#text:
Nothing in this section may be construed as
			 affecting obligations to disclose United States Government information under
			 any other provision of law.

header.#text:
Contracts
			 entered into under unusual and compelling urgency exception

text.#text:
The head of an executive agency
			 may not rely on the exception under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to enter into a
			 contract to procure property or services in connection with natural disaster
			 reconstruction efforts using procedures other than competitive procedures
			 unless the contract will be performed within a 6-month period.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 303(c)(2) of the Federal Property
			 and Administrative Services Act of 1949
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949/s:303/ss:c/p:2
Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, respectively, shall be 7
			 calendar days after the date on which a contract described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:5/ss:a/p:1
Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2013/s:6/ss:a

text.#text:
The notification and
			 disclosure deadlines under

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for full and open competition for Federal
		  contracts related to natural disaster reconstruction efforts.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs
